text: Drakes Creek is a stream in Warren County, Kentucky, in the United States. It is a tributary of the Barren River. Drakes Creek, as measured at Alvaton, has a mean annual discharge of 768 cubic feet per second.https://waterdata.usgs.gov/ky/nwis/annual/?format=sites_selection_links&search;_site_no=03314000&agency;_cd=USGS&referred_module=sw Drakes Creek was named for a white pioneer named Drake who narrowly escaped with his life an attack by Indians. The Shaker community of South Union, Kentucky, attempted a settlement along the creek, some 16 miles from their main village, in 1817, but the effort was abandoned in 1829. ==See also== *List of rivers of Kentucky ==References== Category:Bodies of water of Warren County, Kentucky Category:Rivers of Kentucky
title: Drakes Creek (Barren River tributary)
